meanings.definition: The practice of using multiple names or terms to refer to the same thing.
meanings.sent1: In the book, the author explained the concept of polyonymy by showing how characters had different names.
meanings.sent2: Polyonymy is common in scientific fields where one discovery may have various names depending on the researcher.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the game of using polyonymy to refer to each other led to confusion and laughter.
meanings.sent4: The world of fashion is a polyonymy of trends, with each season bringing new names and styles.
meanings.sent5: Polyonymy, like a colorful palette, allows for a rich tapestry of language and expression.

meanings.definition: The state of having multiple names or terms to refer to the same thing.
meanings.sent1: The polyonymy of the city was evident in its street signs, each displaying names in different languages.
meanings.sent2: The polyonymy of the rare flower confused botanists who couldn't agree on a single name for it.
meanings.sent3: The polyonymy of the famous actor caused fans to create a playful nickname that stuck.
meanings.sent4: In the world of technology, the polyonymy of gadgets can make it hard to keep up with the latest releases.
meanings.sent5: The polyonymy of the ancient artifact hinted at its rich history and cultural significance.
